00051 
00052 ## @brief The Screen class is a widget that provides an easy way of handling multiple views.
00053 #
00054 # This class is capable of managing various views of the same model and provides
00055 # functions for moving to the next and previous record.
00056 #
00057 # If neither setViewTypes() nor setViewIds() are called, form and tree views (in this order)
00058 # will be used. If you use only a single 'id' and say it's a 'tree', one you try to switchView
00059 # the default 'form' view will be shown. If you only want to show the 'tree' view, use 
00060 # setViewTypes( [] ) or setViewTypes( ['tree'] )
00061 # When you add a new view by it's ID the type of the given view is removed from the list of
00062 # view types. (See: addViewById() )
00063 #
00064 # A Screen can emit four different signals:
00065 #   activated() -> Emited each time a record is activated (such as a double click on a list).
00066 #   closed() -> Emited when a view asks for the screen to be closed (such as a 'close' button on a form).
00067 #   currentChanged() -> Emited when the current record has been modified. 
00068 #   recordMessage(int,int,int) -> Emited each time the current record changes (such as moving to previous or next).
00069 class Screen(QScrollArea):
00070 
00071         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00072                 QScrollArea.__init__(self, parent)
00073                 self.setFocusPolicy( Qt.NoFocus )
00074 
00075                 # GUI Stuff
00076                 self.setFrameShape( QFrame.NoFrame )
00077                 self.setWidgetResizable( True )
00078                 self.container = QWidget( self )
00079                 self.setWidget( self.container )
00080 
00081                 self.container.show()
00082 
00083                 self.searchForm = SearchFormWidget(self.container)
00084                 self.connect( self.searchForm, SIGNAL('search()'), self.search )
00085                 self.connect( self.searchForm, SIGNAL('keyDownPressed()'), self.setFocusToView )
00086                 self.searchForm.hide()
00087                 self.containerView = None
00088 
00089                 self.toolBar = ToolBar(self)
00090                 self.toolBar.hide()
00091 
00092                 self.layout = QHBoxLayout()
00093                 self.layout.setSpacing( 0 )
00094                 self.layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00095                 self.layout.addWidget( self.toolBar )
00096 
00097                 vLay = QVBoxLayout( self.container )
00098                 vLay.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00099                 vLay.addWidget( self.searchForm )
00100                 vLay.addLayout( self.layout )
00101 
00102                 # Non GUI Stuff
00103                 self.actions = []
00104 
00105                 self._embedded = True
00106 
00107                 self.views_preload = {}
00108                 self.rpc = None
00109                 self.name = None
00110                 self.views = {}
00111                 self.fields = {}
00112                 self.group = None
00113                 self._currentRecordPosition = None
00114                 self._currentRecord = None
00115                 self._currentView = -1
00116                 self._previousView = -1
00117 
00118                 self._viewQueue = ViewQueue()
00119 
00120         ## @brief Sets the focus to current view.
00121         def setFocusToView(self):
00122                 self.currentView().setFocus()
00123 
00124         def sizeHint(self):
00125                 return self.container.sizeHint()
00126 
00127         def setPreloadedViews(self, views):
00128                 self.views_preload = views
00129 
00130         def preloadedViews(self, views):
00131                 return self.views_preload
00132                 
00133         ## @brief Initializes the list of views using a types list and an ids list.
00134         #
00135         # Example: 
00136         # 
00137         # screen.setupViews( ['tree','form'], [False, False] )
00138         def setupViews(self, types, ids):
00139                 self._viewQueue.setup( types, ids )
00140                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00141                 if self.name:
00142                         self.switchView()
00143 
00144         def setViewIds(self, ids):
00145                 self._viewQueue.setViewIds( ids )
00146                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00147                 if self.name:
00148                         self.switchView()
00149 
00150         def viewIds(self):
00151                 return self._viewIds
00152 
00153         def setViewTypes(self, types):
00154                 self._viewQueue.setViewTypes( types )
00155                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00156                 if self.name:
00157                         self.switchView()
00158 
00159         ## @brief Sets whether the screen is embedded.
00160         #
00161         # Embedded screens don't show the search or toolbar widgets.
00162         # By default embedded is True so it doesn't load unnecessary forms.
00163         def setEmbedded(self, value):
00164                 self._embedded = value
00165                 self.setToolbarVisible( not value )
00166                 self.setSearchFormVisible( not value )
00167 
00168         ## @brief Returns True if the Screen acts in embedded mode.
00169         def embedded(self):
00170                 return self._embedded
00171 
00172         ## @brief Allows making the toolbar visible or hidden.
00173         def setToolbarVisible(self, value):
00174                 self._toolbarVisible = value
00175                 self.toolBar.setVisible( value )
00176 
00177         ## @brief Allows making the search form visible or hidden.
00178         def setSearchFormVisible(self, value):
00179                 self._searchFormVisible = value
00180                 self.searchForm.setVisible( value )
00181                 if value:
00182                         if self.currentView() and self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00183                                 self.loadSearchForm()
00184 
00185         def loadSearchForm(self):
00186                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() and not self._embedded: 
00187                         if not self.searchForm.isLoaded():
00188                                 form = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'fields_view_get', False, 'form', self.context)
00189                                 self.searchForm.setup( form['arch'], form['fields'], self.resource )
00190 
00191                         if self.searchForm.isEmpty():
00192                                 self.searchForm.hide()
00193                         else:
00194                                 self.searchForm.show()
00195                 else:
00196                         self.searchForm.hide()
00197 
00198         ## @brief This function is expected to be used as a slot for an Action trigger signal.
00199         # (as it will check the sender). It will call the Action.execute(id,ids) function.
00200         def triggerAction(self):
00201                 # We expect a Screen.Action here
00202                 action = self.sender()
00203 
00204                 # Do not trigger action if there is no record selected. This is
00205                 # only permitted for plugins.
00206                 if not self.currentId() and action.type() != 'plugin':
00207                         return
00208 
00209                 id = self.currentId()
00210                 ids = self.selectedIds()
00211 
00212                 if action.type() != 'relate':
00213                         self.save()
00214                         self.display()
00215 
00216                 action.execute( id, ids )
00217 
00218                 if action.type() != 'relate':
00219                         self.reload()
00220 
00221         ## @brief Sets the current widget of the Screen
00222         def setView(self, widget):
00223                 if self.containerView:
00224                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("activated()"), self.activate )
00225                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("currentChanged(PyQt_PyObject)"), self.currentChanged)
00226                         self.containerView.hide()
00227 
00228                 self.containerView = widget
00229                 # Calling first "loadSearchForm()" because when the search form is hidden
00230                 # it looks better to the user. If we show the widget and then hide the search
00231                 # form it produces an ugly flickering.
00232                 self.loadSearchForm()
00233                 widget.show()
00234                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("activated()"), self.activate )
00235                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("currentChanged(PyQt_PyObject)"), self.currentChanged)
00236 
00237                 # Set focus proxy so other widgets can try to setFocus to us
00238                 # and the focus is set to the expected widget.
00239                 self.setFocusProxy( self.containerView )
00240 
00241                 self.layout.insertWidget( 0, widget )
00242                 self.ensureWidgetVisible( widget )
00243 
00244         def activate( self ):
00245                 self.emit( SIGNAL('activated()') )
00246 
00247         def close( self ):
00248                 self.emit( SIGNAL('closed()') )
00249 
00250         ## @brief Searches with the current parameters of the search form and loads the
00251         # models that fit the criteria.
00252         def search( self ):
00253                 value = self.searchForm.value()
00254                 self.group.setFilter( value )
00255                 self.group.update()
00256                 if self.group.count() > 0:
00257                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( 0 ) )
00258                 else:
00259                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00260                 self.display()
00261 
00262         # Slot to recieve the signal from a view when the current item changes
00263         def currentChanged(self, model):
00264                 self.setCurrentRecord( model )
00265                 self.emit( SIGNAL('currentChanged()') )
00266 
00267         ## @brief Sets the RecordGroup this Screen should show.
00268         # @param group RecordGroup object.
00269         def setRecordGroup(self, group):
00270                 if not group:
00271                         self.group = None
00272                         self._currentRecord = None
00273                         self._currentRecordPosition = None
00274                         # Call setCurrentRecord() after setting self.group
00275                         # because it will emit a signal with the count of elements
00276                         # which must be 0.
00277                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00278                         return
00279 
00280                 self.name = group.resource
00281                 self.resource = group.resource
00282                 self.context = group.context()
00283                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(self.resource)
00284 
00285                 self.group = group
00286                 self._currentRecord = None
00287                 self._currentRecordPosition = None
00288 
00289                 group.addFields(self.fields)
00290                 self.fields.update(group.fields)
00291 
00292         ## @brief Returns a reference the current record (Record).
00293         def currentRecord(self):
00294                 # Checking _currentRecordPosition before count() can save a search() call to the server because
00295                 # count() will execute a search() in the server if no items have been loaded yet. What happens is
00296                 # that the first time a screen with a TreeView is shown currentRecord() will be called but there
00297                 # will be no currentRecord. TreeView then will set the appropiate order by loading settings from 
00298                 # the server through restoreViewSettings, and KooModel will load data on demand.
00299                 if self._currentRecordPosition >= 0 and self.group.count():
00300                         # Use modelByIndex because this ensures all missing fields of the model
00301                         # are loaded. For example, the model could have been loaded in tree view
00302                         # but now might need more fields for form view.
00303                         return self.group.modelByIndex( self._currentRecordPosition )
00304                 else:
00305                         # New records won't have that problem (althouth the problem might be that
00306                         # fields haven't been created yet??)
00307                         return self._currentRecord
00308 
00309         ## @brief Sets the current record.
00310         #
00311         # Note that value will be a reference to the Record.
00312         def setCurrentRecord(self, value):
00313                 self._currentRecord = value
00314                 if self.group and self.group.recordExists( value ):
00315                         pos = self.group.indexOfRecord( value )
00316                 else:
00317                         pos = -1
00318                 self._currentRecordPosition = pos
00319                 if value and value.id:
00320                         id = value.id
00321                 else:
00322                         id = -1
00323                 if self.group:
00324                         count = self.group.count()
00325                 else:
00326                         count = 0
00327                 self.emit(SIGNAL('recordMessage(int,int,int)'), pos, count, id)
00328                 if self._currentRecord:
00329                         if self.currentView():
00330                                 self.currentView().setSelected(self._currentRecord.id)
00331 
00332         ## @brief Switches the current view to the previous one. If viewType (such as 'calendar') 
00333         # is given it will switch to that view type.
00334         def switchView(self, viewType = None):
00335                 if self.currentView(): 
00336                         self.currentView().store()
00337 
00338                 if self.currentRecord() and ( not self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ) ):
00339                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00340 
00341                 if viewType:
00342                         self._previousView = self._currentView
00343                         self._currentView = self._viewQueue.indexFromType( viewType )
00344                 else:
00345                         if self._currentView >= 0:
00346                                 # Swap currentView and previousView values
00347                                 self._currentView, self._previousView = self._previousView, self._currentView
00348                         else:
00349                                 self._currentView = 0
00350                         # The second time switchView is executed, currentView might get -1
00351                         # and we want it in fact to be 1 ...
00352                         self._currentView = abs(self._currentView)
00353                         # ... unless there's only one view
00354                         self._currentView = min(self._currentView, self._viewQueue.count()-1)
00355 
00356                 self.setView( self.currentView() )
00357                 if self.currentRecord():
00358                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00359                 self.display()
00360 
00361         ## @brief Loads the next view pending to be loaded.
00362         # If there is no view pending it returns False, otherwise returns True.
00363         def loadNextView(self):
00364                 if self._viewQueue.isEmpty():
00365                         return False
00366 
00367                 (id, type) = self._viewQueue.next()
00368                 self.addViewByIdAndType( id, type )
00369                 return True
00370 
00371 
00372         ## @brief Adds a view given it's id and type.
00373         #
00374         # This function is needed to resemble server's fields_view_get function. This 
00375         # function wasn't necessary but accounting module needs it because it tries to
00376         # open a view with it's ID but reimplements fields_view_get and checks the view
00377         # type.
00378         #
00379         # @see AddViewById
00380         # @see AddViewByType
00381         def addViewByIdAndType(self, id, type, display=False):
00382                 if type in self.views_preload:
00383                         return self.addView(self.views_preload[type]['arch'], self.views_preload[type]['fields'], display, toolbar=self.views_preload[type].get('toolbar', False), id=self.views_preload[type].get('view_id',False))
00384                 else:
00385                         # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00386                         # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00387                         # and can be set later.
00388                         view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(id, type, self.context, True)
00389                         return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=view['view_id'])
00390                 
00391         ## @brief Adds a view given its id.
00392         # @param id View id to load or False if you want to load given view_type.
00393         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False).
00394         # @return The view widget
00395         # 
00396         # @see AddViewByType
00397         # @see AddViewByIdAndType
00398         def addViewById(self, id, display=False):
00399                 # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00400                 # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00401                 # and can be set later.
00402                 view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(id, False, self.context, True)
00403                 return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=id)
00404                 
00405         ## @brief Adds a view given a view type.
00406         # @param type View type ('form', 'tree', 'calendar', 'graph'...). 
00407         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False).
00408         # @return The view widget
00409         #
00410         # @see AddViewById
00411         # @see AddViewByIdAndType
00412         def addViewByType(self, type, display=False):
00413                 if type in self.views_preload:
00414                         return self.addView(self.views_preload[type]['arch'], self.views_preload[type]['fields'], display, toolbar=self.views_preload[type].get('toolbar', False), id=self.views_preload[type].get('view_id',False))
00415                 else:
00416                         # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00417                         # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00418                         # and can be set later.
00419                         view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(False, type, self.context, True)
00420                         return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=view['view_id'])
00421                 
00422         ## @brief Adds a view given it's XML description and fields
00423         # @param arch XML string: typically 'arch' field returned by model fields_view_get() function.
00424         # @param fields Fields dictionary containing each field (widget) properties.
00425         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False)
00426         # @param toolbar Toolbar information as returned from fields_view_get server function.
00427         # @param id View id. This parameter is used for storing and loading settings for the view. If id=False, no
00428         #               settings will be stored/loaded.
00429         # @return The view widget
00430         def addView(self, arch, fields, display=False, toolbar={}, id=False):
00431                 def _parse_fields(node, fields):
00432                         if node.nodeType == node.ELEMENT_NODE:
00433                                 if node.localName=='field':
00434                                         attrs = Common.nodeAttributes(node)
00435                                         if attrs.get('widget', False):
00436                                                 if attrs['widget']=='one2many_list':
00437                                                         attrs['widget']='one2many'
00438                                                 attrs['type'] = attrs['widget']
00439                                         try:
00440                                                 fields[attrs['name']].update(attrs)
00441                                         except:
00442                                                 print "-"*30,"\n malformed tag for :", attrs
00443                                                 print "-"*30
00444                                                 raise                                           
00445                         for node2 in node.childNodes:
00446                                 _parse_fields(node2, fields)
00447                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(arch.encode('utf-8'))
00448                 _parse_fields(dom, fields)
00449 
00450                 self.group.addFields(fields)
00451 
00452                 self.fields = self.group.fields
00453 
00454                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(arch.encode('utf-8'))
00455                 view = ViewFactory.create(id, self, self.resource, dom, self.fields)
00456                 self.setOnWriteFunction( view.onWriteFunction() )
00457                 # Load view settings
00458                 view.setViewSettings( ViewSettings.load( view.id ) )
00459 
00460                 self.views[ view.viewType() ] = view
00461                 self.loadActions( toolbar )
00462 
00463                 if display:
00464                         if not self._viewQueue.typeExists( view.viewType() ):
00465                                 self._viewQueue.addViewType( view.viewType() )
00466                         self._currentView = self._viewQueue.indexFromType( view.viewType() )
00467                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00468                         self.setView(view)
00469                 return view
00470 
00471         ## @brief Loads all actions associated with the current model including plugins.
00472         def loadActions( self, actions ):
00473                 self.actions = ActionFactory.create( self, actions, self.resource )
00474                 if self.actions:
00475                         for action in self.actions:
00476                                 self.connect( action, SIGNAL('triggered()'), self.triggerAction )
00477                         # If there's only one action it will be the 'Print Screen' action
00478                         # that is added "manually" by ActionFactory. In those cases in which
00479                         # Print Screen is the only action we won't show it in the toolbar. We
00480                         # don't consider Plugins a good reason to show the toolbar either.
00481                         # This way dashboards won't show the toolbar, though the option will
00482                         # remain available in the menu for those screens that don't have any
00483                         # actions configured in the server, but Print Screen can be useful.
00484                         if len(self.actions) > 1 + len(Plugins.list(self.resource)) and Options.options['show_toolbar']:
00485                                 self.toolBar.setup( self.actions )
00486 
00487         ## @brief Returns True if the current view is read-only. Returns False if it's read-write.
00488         def isReadOnly(self):
00489                 return self.currentView().isReadOnly()
00490 
00491         ## @brief Creates a new record in the current model. If the current view is not editable
00492         # it will automatically switch to a view that allows editing.
00493         def new(self, default=True):
00494                 if self.currentView() and self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() \
00495                                 and self.currentView().isReadOnly():
00496                         self.switchView()
00497 
00498                 record = self.group.create( default, self.newRecordPosition(), self.group.domain(), self.context )
00499 
00500                 if self.currentView():
00501                         self.currentView().reset()
00502 
00503                 self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00504                 self.display()
00505 
00506                 if self.currentView():
00507                         self.currentView().startEditing()
00508                 return self.currentRecord()
00509 
00510         ## @brief Returns 0 or -1 depending on new records policy for the current view.
00511         # If the view adds on top it will return 0, otherwise it will return -1
00512         def newRecordPosition(self):
00513                 if self.currentView() and self.currentView().addOnTop():
00514                         return 0
00515                 else:
00516                         return -1 
00517 
00518         ## @brief Sets the on_write function. That is the function (in the server) that must
00519         # be called after storing a record.
00520         def setOnWriteFunction(self, functionName):
00521                 self.group.setOnWriteFunction( functionName )
00522 
00523         ## @brief Stores all modified models.
00524         def save(self):
00525                 if not self.currentRecord():
00526                         return False
00527                 self.currentView().store()
00528                 
00529                 id = False
00530                 if self.currentRecord().validate():
00531                         id = self.currentRecord().save(reload=True)
00532                 else:
00533                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00534                         return False
00535                 
00536                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00537                         for record in self.group.modifiedRecords():
00538                                 if record.validate():
00539                                         id = record.save(reload=True)
00540                                 else:
00541                                         self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00542                                         self.display()
00543                                         return False
00544                         self.display()
00545 
00546                 self.display()
00547                 return id
00548 
00549         ## @brief Reload current model and refreshes the view.
00550         #
00551         # If the current view only shows a single record, only the current one will
00552         # be reloaded. If the view shows multiple records it will reload the whole model.
00553         def reload(self):
00554                 if not self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00555                         if self.currentRecord():
00556                                 self.currentRecord().reload()
00557                                 self.display()
00558                         return
00559 
00560                 id = 0
00561                 idx = -1
00562                 if self.currentRecord():
00563                         id = self.currentId()
00564                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())
00565                         
00566                 self.group.update()
00567                 if id:
00568                         record = self.group.modelById( id )
00569                         
00570                         if record:
00571                                 self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00572                         else:
00573                                 # If what it was the current record no longer exists
00574                                 # at least keep index position
00575                                 idx = min( idx, self.group.count() - 1 )
00576                                 if idx >= 0:
00577                                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00578                                 else:
00579                                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00580                 else:
00581                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00582                 self.display()
00583 
00584         ## @brief Removes all new records and marks all modified ones as not loaded.
00585         def cancel(self):
00586                 idx = -1
00587                 if self.currentRecord():
00588                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord( self.currentRecord() )
00589                         
00590                 self.group.cancel()
00591                 if idx != -1:
00592                         idx = min( idx, self.group.count() - 1 )
00593                         if idx >= 0:
00594                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00595                         else:
00596                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00597                         self.display()
00598 
00599         ## @brief Returns a reference to the current view.
00600         def currentView(self):
00601                 if self._currentView < 0:
00602                         return None
00603                 type = self._viewQueue.typeFromIndex( self._currentView )
00604                 if not type in self.views:
00605                         (id, type) = self._viewQueue.viewFromType( type )
00606                         self.addViewByIdAndType( id, type )
00607                 return self.views[ type ]
00608 
00609         ## @brief Returns a dictionary with all field values for the current record. 
00610         def get(self):
00611                 if not self.currentRecord():
00612                         return None
00613                 self.currentView().store()
00614                 return self.currentRecord().get()
00615 
00616         ## @brief Returns True if any record has been modified. Returns False otherwise.
00617         def isModified(self):
00618                 if not self.currentRecord():
00619                         return False
00620                 self.currentView().store()
00621                 res = False
00622                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00623                         return self.group.isModified()
00624                 else:
00625                         return self.currentRecord().isModified()
00626 
00627         ## @brief Removes all selected ids.
00628         #
00629         # If unlink is False (the default) records are only removed from the list. If
00630         # unlink is True records will be removed from the server too.
00631         def remove(self, unlink = False):
00632                 ids = self.selectedIds()
00633                 if unlink and ids:
00634                         # Remove records with id None as they would cause an exception
00635                         # trying to remove from the server 
00636                         idsToUnlink = [x for x in ids if x != None]
00637                         # It could be that after removing records with id == None
00638                         # there are no records to remove from the database. That is,
00639                         # all records that should be removed are new and not stored yet.
00640                         if idsToUnlink:
00641                                 unlinked = self.rpc.unlink( idsToUnlink )       
00642                                 # Try to be consistent with database
00643                                 # If records could not be removed from the database
00644                                 # don't remove them on the client. Don't report it directly
00645                                 # though as probably an exception (Warning) has already
00646                                 # been shown to the user.
00647                                 if not unlinked:
00648                                         return False
00649                 for x in ids:
00650                         model = self.group[x]
00651                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord( model )
00652                         self.group.remove( model )
00653                         if self.group.count():
00654                                 idx = min(idx, self.group.count() - 1)
00655                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00656                         else:
00657                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00658                 self.display()
00659                 if ids:
00660                         return True
00661                 else:
00662                         return False
00663 
00664         ## @brief Loads the given ids to the RecordGroup and refreshes the view.
00665         def load(self, ids):
00666                 self.currentView().reset()
00667                 self.group.load( ids, display =True )
00668                 if ids:
00669                         self.display(ids[0])
00670                 else:
00671                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00672                         self.display()
00673 
00674         ## @brief Displays the record with id 'id' or refreshes the current record if 
00675         # no id is given.
00676         def display(self, id=None):
00677                 if id:
00678                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group[id] )
00679                 if self.views:
00680                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00681 
00682         ## @brief Moves current record to the next one in the list and displays it in the 
00683         # current view.
00684         def displayNext(self):
00685                 self.currentView().store()
00686                 if self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ):
00687                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())
00688                         idx = (idx+1) % self.group.count()
00689                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.modelByIndex(idx) )
00690                 else:
00691                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.count() and self.group.modelByIndex(0) )
00692                 if self.currentRecord():
00693                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00694                 self.display()
00695 
00696         ## @brief Moves current record to the previous one in the list and displays it in the 
00697         # current view.
00698         def displayPrevious(self):
00699                 self.currentView().store()
00700                 if self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ):
00701                         #idx = self.group.records.index(self.currentRecord())-1
00702                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())-1
00703                         if idx<0:
00704                                 idx = self.group.count()-1
00705                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.modelByIndex(idx) )
00706                 else:
00707                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.count() and self.group.modelByIndex(-1) )
00708 
00709                 if self.currentRecord():
00710                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00711                 self.display()
00712 
00713         ## @brief Returns all selected record ids.
00714         def selectedIds(self):
00715                 return self.currentView().selectedIds()
00716 
00717         ## @brief Returns the current record id.
00718         def currentId(self):
00719                 if self.currentRecord():
00720                         return self.currentRecord().id
00721                 else:
00722                         return None
00723 
00724         ## @brief Returns a list with all loaded (or preloaded) record ids.
00725         def allIds(self):
00726                 return [x.id for x in self.group if x.id]
00727 
00728         ## @brief Clears the list of records and refreshes the view.
00729         #
00730         # Note that this won't remove the records from the database. But clears
00731         # the records from the model. It means that sometimes you might want to
00732         # use setRecordGroup( None ) instead of calling clear(). This is what
00733         # OneToMany and ManyToMany widgets do, for example.
00734         # @see remove()
00735         def clear(self):
00736                 self.group.clear()
00737                 self.display()
00738 
00739         ## @brief Stores settings of all opened views
00740         def storeViewSettings(self):
00741                 for view in self.views.values():
00742                         ViewSettings.store( view.id, view.viewSettings() )
00743
